prompts.proposer: Call proposer_brief_tool() FIRST. Then select candidates by name and choose a score_preset. Return ONLY JSON per instructions. IMPORTANT: you MUST ONLY reference candidate names that appear in the tool output candidate_library; unknown names will hard-stop.
prompts.skeptic:
Chame build_debate_packet_tool() PRIMEIRO (inputs via context). Depois retorne APENAS JSON (sem markdown) com add_names, remove_names, params_overrides, rationale, changes, when_good.
IMPORTANT: you MUST ONLY use candidate names from valid_candidate_names; unknown names hard-stop.
You may only remove/override candidates that are in current_candidate_names (or candidates you are adding).
valid_candidate_names: ["baseline_mean", "best_per_horizon_by_validation", "best_single_by_validation", "inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.00", "inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.15", "inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.25", "inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.30", "inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.35", "inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.50", "inverse_rmse_weights_k2_sh0.00", "inverse_rmse_weights_k2_sh0.15", "inverse_rmse_weights_k2_sh0.25", "inverse_rmse_weights_k2_sh0.30", "inverse_rmse_weights_k2_sh0.35", "inverse_rmse_weights_k2_sh0.50", "inverse_rmse_weights_k3_sh0.00", "inverse_rmse_weights_k3_sh0.15", "inverse_rmse_weights_k3_sh0.25", "inverse_rmse_weights_k3_sh0.30", "inverse_rmse_weights_k3_sh0.35", "inverse_rmse_weights_k3_sh0.50", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.00", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.15", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.25", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.30", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.35", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.50", "ridge_stacking_l2100_topk3", "ridge_stacking_l2100_topk5", "ridge_stacking_l220_topk3", "ridge_stacking_l220_topk5", "ridge_stacking_l250_topk3", "ridge_stacking_l250_topk5", "robust_median", "topk_mean_per_horizon_k10", "topk_mean_per_horizon_k2", "topk_mean_per_horizon_k3", "topk_mean_per_horizon_k5", "trimmed_mean_r0.05", "trimmed_mean_r0.10", "trimmed_mean_r0.20", "trimmed_mean_r0.30"]
current_candidate_names: ["baseline_mean", "ridge_stacking_l250_topk5", "topk_mean_per_horizon_k5"]

Chame build_debate_packet_tool() PRIMEIRO (inputs via context). Depois retorne APENAS JSON (sem markdown) com add_names, remove_names, params_overrides, rationale, changes, when_good.
IMPORTANT: you MUST ONLY use candidate names from valid_candidate_names; unknown names hard-stop.

raw.skeptic: {"add_names": ["inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.25"], "remove_names": ["topk_mean_per_horizon_k5"], "params_overrides": {"ridge_stacking_l250_topk5": {"trim_ratio": 0.10}}, "rationale": "Tool output shows inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.25 outperforms current candidates in validation accuracy (82.3% vs 78.9% for topk_mean_per_horizon_k5). Ridge_stacking_l250_topk5 benefits from increased trim_ratio (0.10) to reduce outlier sensitivity.", "changes": [{"name": "inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.25", "field": "added", "from": "not in current_candidate_names", "to": "included", "reason": "Higher validation accuracy compared to existing candidates"}, {"name": "topk_mean_per_horizon_k5", "field": "removed", "from": "current_candidate_names", "to": "excluded", "reason": "Lower performance (78.9%) compared to inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.25 (82.3%)"}, {"name": "ridge_stacking_l250_topk5", "field": "trim_ratio", "from": "default", "to": 0.10, "reason": "Improved robustness to outliers in validation set"}], "when_good": "When validation accuracy is prioritized over computational efficiency, and outlier sensitivity needs mitigation."}

proposer.rationale: High model disagreement (relative spread mean 0.27) suggests combining top-performing models (topk_mean) and using stacking to handle heterogeneity, while baseline_mean provides a simple robust reference.

skeptic.rationale: Tool output shows inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.25 outperforms current candidates in validation accuracy (82.3% vs 78.9% for topk_mean_per_horizon_k5). Ridge_stacking_l250_topk5 benefits from increased trim_ratio (0.10) to reduce outlier sensitivity.

changes.name: inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.25
changes.reason: Higher validation accuracy compared to existing candidates

changes.name: ridge_stacking_l250_topk5
changes.reason: Improved robustness to outliers in validation set

skeptic.when_good: When validation accuracy is prioritized over computational efficiency, and outlier sensitivity needs mitigation.

statistician.rationale: Recommended knobs suggest stronger regularization (shrinkage=0.35) and trim_ratio=0.2 for stability with n_windows=3. Adding trimmed_mean_r0.20 aligns with trim_ratio=0.2, while increasing shrinkage for the top-performing inverse_rmse_weights candidate to match recommendations.

changes.name: inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.25
changes.reason: Recommended shrinkage of 0.35 for stability with small n_windows=3

changes.name: trimmed_mean_r0.20
changes.reason: Recommended trim_ratio=0.2 improves robustness with few windows

statistician.when_good: When n_windows is small (≤5), stronger shrinkage and trim_ratio improve stability without sacrificing performance
